paper.title: Subclasses of Self-Modifying Nets
paper.venue: Selected Papers from the First and the Second European Workshop on Application and Theory of Petri Nets
paper.abstract: Petri nets (PT-nets) have proved as an excellent tool for the description and analysis of dynamic systems exhibiting concurrency. Nevertheless applications to problems in practice are rare. Among others one reason is that Petri nets for complex systems rapidly grow in size soon loosing their clearness and becoming unmanageable. In order to increase the abilities of Petri nets several extensions have been suggested in a more or less systematic way (e. g., inhibitor, reset arcs, transitions with special properties etc.).
